s.text: Mark Shields Loves Late Edition : Punditry's leading exponent of redundancy, Mark Shields, plows new ground on NewsHour . Ordinarily, he recycles sound bites from his Friday NewsHour gig on Saturday's Capital Gang . This week, Shields expresses amazement at the White House spin machine's "cautious, almost slow" response to the Chinagate accusations.

Doris Kearns Goodwin ( Meet the Press ) further puddles the issue, insisting the "whole system has become corrupted."
Doris Kearns Goodwin ( Meet the Press ) further puddles the issue, insisting the "whole system has become corrupted."

Starr is batting "10 for 10" against presidential legal challenges, note Tim Russert ( Meet the Press ) and Fred Barnes ( Fox News Sunday ), proving that he's "not a rogue prosecutor" (Susan Page, Late Edition ). "The judge was downright scornful of the White House," adds Barnes.
